thread.section_title: Broward County High School Sports - Sun Sentinel
thread.title: Archbishop McCarthy runs over Glades Day
thread.title_full: Archbishop McCarthy runs over Glades Day - Sun Sentinel

author: Scott A. Salomon
title: Archbishop McCarthy runs over Glades Day
text:
Anthony Rey rushed for 146 yards on 18 carries and scored two touchdowns Friday night as Archbishop McCarthy defeated Glades Day 34-7.
The senior running back scored on a 60-yard jaunt on the first play of the second half to put the game away for the Mavericks who ran their record to 6-.0. With the loss, Glades Day drops to 3-3.
Rey also scored on a six-yard run up the middle in the second quarter. Another touchdown was called back by penalty in the fourth quarter.
Senior kicker Nick Costa booted two field goals to pace the Mavericks in victory. Eric Paul, the senior quarterback for McCarthy scored the final touchdown on a keeper on fourth and goal.
The Archbishop McCarthy defense intercepted Gators' quarterback Cory Surls four times on the evening. Sophomore defensive back Logan Giordano picked off two of Sauls' passes.
Lorenzo Powe, an eight grader on Glades Day's varsity squad, scored the Gators' lone touchdown on a two-yard dive in the second quarter to make the score 10-7.
